{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3329446,"name":"","username":"BrentonB","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/cdc98d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T00:13:11.764Z","cooked":"

I am asking for help about setting motors to run on xbox controller button press and stop on another button press.

I have looked at other posts about motors on buttons and read wpilib documentation, but everything I have tried has resulted in the wheels not spinning, the wheels spinning for a second before immediately stopping and triggering some kind of motor safety error in the driver station.

My github with my project is here

I forgot to specify that all the main robot code is in DriveTrain.Java

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T00:20:25.308Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458180,"topic_slug":"running-motors-on-button","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/running-motors-on-button/458180/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329504,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T01:43:42.549Z","cooked":"

Your controller.getRawButton() call is outside of your periodic method, so the variable you’re assigning to probably isn’t being updated every robot frame period.
Is there a reason you are using stopMotor() as opposed to just set(0) when the button isn’t held?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T01:43:42.549Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458180,"topic_slug":"running-motors-on-button","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53512,"username":"BrentonB","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/cdc98d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/running-motors-on-button/458180/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329518,"name":"","username":"BrentonB","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/cdc98d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T01:58:08.937Z","cooked":"

Your controller.getRawButton() call is outside of your periodic method

I hadn’t realized that. I am not sure what I was doing there

Is there a reason you are using stopMotor() as opposed to just set(0) when the button isn’t held?

I am not sure why, It just made sense to me to use StopMotor() instead of set(0). I could probably switch that around too

if you want the code boolean xboxXbutton = controller.getRawButton(3); to be outside a method so any method can access it, then you should make it a booleansupplier, it will actually do the code you write when called instead of once on object instantiation then never again.
it might look like this

BooleanSupplier myboolsuplier= () -> controller.getRawButton(3); 

then test it with --> System.out.println(myboolsuplier.getAsBoolean());
